lines.text: Tutto coso sono buono.
Er... what does that mean, Boss?
You can't speak Italian?
No, Boss, I'm Jewish.
Then read the translations!

Everything's Hunky Dory]
Oh. Oh, alles is gut!
[Her face plastered with custard pies]
So this is show business.
I like my men at my feet.
Have you eaten?
Ever since I was a kid.
Then how come you're so skinny, wisey?
Because I watch my weight.
Yeah, I do that when I'm broke too.
[talking about Blousey]
You ever seen a broad carry a torch so high?
Yeah, the Statue of Liberty.
Is he there?
No. There's no answer.
[hanging up]
Then get him to me - poysonally.
Personally?

[hand gestures]
Poysonally.
Poysonally.

[Immediately after Fat Sam slips on the wet floor]
Be careful boss the floor is wet.
Okay fellas, this is our moment. Keep a cool head and keep those fingers pumpin', 'cause remember, it's history you'll be writin'.

[as the speakeasy is closing down for the night and everyone is leaving]
Tallulah! How much longer you want us to wait?

[sweetly yet slightly sarcastically]
Coming honey, you don't want me to look a mess, do you sweetheart?
Snap it up, will ya?
Put your flaps down tiger or else you'll take off.

[annoyed]
You spend more time prettying yourself up then there is time in the day!

[pointedly]
Listen honey, if I didn't look this good, you wouldn't give me the time of day.

[rejectedly]
I'll see you in the car!

[becoming aggravated as Knuckles is cracking his knuckles repeatedly]
Don't do that, Knuckles!
It's how I got my name, boss.
Well knock it off or else change your name!
Louis, over there into the corner.
Me boss? Why me, boss?
Louis, into the corner.
What'd I do boss?
Nothing Louis.
[throws pie at Louis and misses]
Ya see? Missed. Okay Louis, you can sit down now.
Oh, hi, Bugsy.
Hi, Bangles. Is Blousey there, please?
She won't see you.
Tell her I'm sick.
You're sick?
Yeah, sick of waiting.
[Get Baby Face!]
[Get Baby Face! I am Baby Face, what am I saying?]
Look pal, the food counters closed,the bar is closed,my eyes are closing. In fact, the whole joints closed.
Your name Robinson?
[nods nervously]
Roxy Robinson?
[nods nervously again]
You work for Fat Sam?
[nods once final time before being splurged to death]
[first lines]

Someone once said, "If it was raining brains, Roxy Robinson wouldn't even get wet." Roxy had spent his whole life making two and two into five, but he could smell trouble like other people could smell gas. But believe you's me, he should've never taken that blind alley by the side of Parido's Bakery. Whatever game it was everybody was playing, sure as eggs is eggs, Roxy the Weasel had been scrambled.
Have you located the splurge gun yet, sir?
I'm afraid I can't answer that.
You're not at liberty to say?

[annoyed]
No, I don't know the answer.
Do you know where the guns are coming from, Lieutenant?
Eh, I'm not at liberty to say. You'll have to ask Captain Smolsky that question.

[noting the solemn look on Matt the Barman's face]
You know what, you look like you put your face on backwards this morning.
You've got too much mouth, mack.
So, tell my dentist.
Me and Fat Sam, we're like this.
[crosses fingers]
You mean you're real good friends?

[shakes head]
Nah, it's just that every time I see him, I cross my fingers, and hope he won't hit me.

[voice-over]
And now my friends, listen to what I'm telling you and listen good. There's only room for one Mr. Big in this town and that's me, Dandy Dan. And fellas, the time has come for us to play our next card, and believe you's me, Fat Sam and his dumb bumbs ain't gonna stand in our way.
Suddenly everybody wants to be in show business.
[repeated line]
Come back tomorrow.
